desc: GATA1 encodes for the gene GATA binding protein 1 that acts as a transcription factor (PMID:1987478). GATA1 activates many critical genes involved in erythroid and megakaryocyte development (PMID:7568185, 7823932), including the beta globin gene and erythropoietin receptor (PMID:1924329, 1660143). Germline mutation in GATA1 is associated with anemia, thrombocytopenia and porphyria (PMID:10700180, 11675338, 16783379, 17148589). Mutation in GATA1 and reduced translation of GATA1 can also lead to Diamond Blackfan anemia (PMID:24952648). The gene is located on the X-chromosome, and thus associated diseases are sex-linked disorders. In patients with Down Syndrome, mutations in GATA1 are observed with acute megakaryocytic leukemia development and transient myeloid disorders (PMID:12172547, 12747884). In solid tumors, select studies suggest GATA1 can regulate tumor aggressiveness and DNA repair (PMID:20101202, 17332341,25230694).
articles/0/title: Acquired mutations in GATA1 in neonates with Down's syndrome with transient myeloid disorder.
articles/1/title: The C-terminal zinc finger of GATA-1 or GATA-2 is sufficient to induce megakaryocytic differentiation of an early myeloid cell line.
articles/2/title: Congenital erythropoietic porphyria due to a mutation in GATA1: the first trans-acting mutation causative for a human porphyria.
articles/3/title: Transcription factor GATA-1 permits survival and maturation of erythroid precursors by preventing apoptosis.
articles/3/journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
articles/4/title: Familial dyserythropoietic anaemia and thrombocytopenia due to an inherited mutation in GATA1.
articles/5/title: Altered translation of GATA1 in Diamond-Blackfan anemia.
articles/6/title: Activation of the erythropoietin receptor promoter by transcription factor GATA-1.
articles/6/journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
articles/7/title: GATA-1 is essential in EGF-mediated induction of nucleotide excision repair activity and ERCC1 expression through ERK2 in human hepatoma cells.
articles/8/title: Decreased mRNA expression of GATA1 and GATA2 is associated with tumor aggressiveness and poor outcome in clear cell renal cell carcinoma.
articles/9/title: Erythroid differentiation in chimaeric mice blocked by a targeted mutation in the gene for transcription factor GATA-1.
articles/10/title: X-linked thrombocytopenia caused by a novel mutation of GATA-1.
articles/11/title: Protein-DNA interactions in vivo of an erythroid-specific, human beta-globin locus enhancer.
articles/11/journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
articles/12/title: The transcription factor GATA-1 is overexpressed in breast carcinomas and contributes to survivin upregulation via a promoter polymorphism.
articles/13/title: An inherited mutation leading to production of only the short isoform of GATA-1 is associated with impaired erythropoiesis.
articles/14/title: Acquired mutations in GATA1 in the megakaryoblastic leukemia of Down syndrome.

desc: GATA1 encodes a transcription factor involved in red blood cell and platelet development. Somatic mutations of GATA1 are found in leukemias.
